body:
When two or more versions or variants of the same package are installed, typing `spack load [ambiguous package spec]` loads all the modules that match the spec. According to the documentation [here](http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/module_file_support.html#ambiguous-module-names), it should instead stop with an error.

Tested with packages 'espresso' and 'zlib', on a Cray machine that already provides the 'modules' command.
title: 'spack load' loads more than one module for the same package
